briefdescription.para: Opaque type representing one of the semicolon-separated items in an address.
Parses an address string of the form:

detaileddescription.para: See the D-Bus specification for complete docs on the format.
When connecting to an address, the first address entries in the semicolon-separated list should be tried first.

parameterdescription.para: return location to an array of entries.
address where an error can be returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns a value from a key of an entry.

detaileddescription.para: For example, given the address "tcp:host=example.com,port=8073" if you asked for the key "host" you would get the value "example.com"
The returned value is already unescaped.

simplesect.para: the key value. This string must not be freed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the method string of an address entry.

detaileddescription.para: For example, given the address entry "tcp:host=example.com" it would return the string "tcp"

simplesect.para: a string describing the method. This string must not be freed.

briefdescription.para: Frees a NULL-terminated array of address entries.
Escapes the given string as a value in a key=value pair for a D-Bus address.

simplesect.para: newly-allocated escaped value or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Unescapes the given string as a value in a key=value pair for a D-Bus address.

detaileddescription.para: Note that dbus_address_entry_get_value() returns an already-unescaped value.

parameterdescription.para: error to set if the unescaping fails

simplesect.para: newly-allocated unescaped value or NULL if no memory
